Entry.1:
very cold night last night wind blowing a gale 

Rain & snow all day, guns booming in the distance 

caught up with the hun at last. Had a notice up "it’s a long way to Tiperary but dam sight longer to Berlin, Come on you Conquering Heroes . 

Expect to shift out of this Tomorrow 

owe 7d deferred Pay £22.12.0 .

Wednesday 21/3/17

By the date you would think Spring was near by the weather you’d think winter just starting. Very cold last night & again today, wind shifted a bit so it might take up. been snowing again, guns going it like mad in the right. Got Fritz again dont think he will want much more of it. 

Hun graves in Bapaume 7 & more in each, must have got hell from our Artillery. 

Pay 5d £22.13.0

letter from Viv & parcel from Maude wrote to Both. Back to Bat. Tomorrow 

Monday 19/3/17.

Cant catch up to the Huns yet all hands moving up, everyone cheerful, The Boys in front are souvenir hunting & getting them galore. One got a Bullet through the lobe of his ear, not the sort he was after, Caught seven Hun snipers , they will not snipe anymore. 

Our Light Horse & Cavalry are trying to get into touch with the enemy 

Heavy gun fire all the morning in the distance. No orders about moveing yet.

Very cold wind from the south more snow. 

I owe 1/7. defer. £22.11.0 

British 6 miles the other side of Le Transloy. Raining

20 &
Entry.3:
Snow inches deep, but not so cold, going back to Bernafay this afternoon. 

Reported that Lille has fallen. The Hun is evidently shortening his line, Said that the Turks are suing for Peace.

 Posting letters to Viv & Maude 

Pay 1/5 def £22.14.0. 

Back again to Bernafay 2.30 P.M. snowed all day, another man in my place. dug-out to myself.
Entry.4:
Sun shining, cold wind blowing, up at 7. 

Pay 2/5 £22.15.0.

must get bath today. 

Turned out bitterly cold after all stayed our fire all day, Called out at 6 pm to arrest Prisoner from Transport lines, drunk, snow or frost tonight
Entry.5:
Bosker frost, gale blowing freezing hands & ears 

Brigade not coming out as expected so it means another Tramp of 10 or 12 miles up to the front. 

Pay 3/5 £22-16-0

Out for 3½ hours looking for another Prisoner; couldn't find him.
Entry.6:
daylight saving in force to day, cold but little frost wind getting up as usual, feet very tired from that long walk yesterday. 

Pay 4/5 £22-17-0. 

Had hot bath first for 2 months. 

Got Prisoner to day. 

off to the front tomorrow. No leave yet. & not likely to be
Entry.7:
of our planes & 2 fritz’s . 

Captured Hun’s Armoured Train.
Entry.8:
Raining like hell, everything on the move expect we go this afternoon, Place Beaulancourt about 7 or 8 miles from here, no more time for writing, 

Packed up ready to start. just heard we don't go till tomorrow 

leave starts on the
Entry.10:
£22-18.0. 

We are going to Villers au Flos about 10 miles away.
Entry.11:
3 17

Up at 7. BK 7.30 off at 10. all details go with us first Delville Wood then Needle Trench, Rise Trench, Millers Son, Millers Daughter. Then Le Transloy & near here Villers au Flos. 

Talk about a walk. it was a beaut. 5 or 6 miles on duck-Boards then through mud for another 4 miles, feet & shoulders nearly made me give in. 

Saw 3 dead Germans alongside the track also some skulls. But shell holes, I’ve seen some before but never anything like this, not a yard between them. Huns must have got hell here in these Trenches. Le Transloy & this place burnt or smashed to Pieces. No civilians, nothing but desolation. 

Snowed nearly all the way here & cold wind blowing, am camped by myself in Ruined house Just a bit of roof left all else open so will be cold tonight. 

At 6 P.M. it is snowing thick & fast My feet acheing terribly don't know how I'll stand another march tomorrow.

Got a good fire going am sleeping under a Partly fallen wall. hope it does not fall in on me, won't matter much if it does, pretty full up of it.

Houses have all been blown down & even fruit Trees cut down 

Pay
Entry.13:
12 months ago today march from Tel-de-Kebir to Moaska, lot died from thirst through getting lost thanks to Genrl. Irving

My left foot gave me fits last night & is not much better this morning, no sleep don't know how I will do this march, 

Guns Banging away quite near us.

Tin sardines and Biscuit for BKs same for Tea last night. No dinner yesterday yet I carried 2 Blankets in my Pack, overcoat and Cape, Bag with rations Rifle & Equipment.

Relieve the 15th Brigade to day

not going today after all thank goodness give my feet a chance. 

No chance of leave now. 

Heavy frost last night. Wind died down at last hope it’s the last of the gales. 

Pay 7/7 £23-0.0.
Entry.14:
Off to Bancourt today about 3 miles, looks like rain. 

Pay 5/7 £23.1-0

3. PM. Got to Bancourt soaked, rained like hell all the way. This place same as others all Houses blown up even the WCs & the Roads blown up & the wells filled in & their own dug-outs either burnt or Blown up. Trees felled across the Roads but most of them fell the other way. Not much good with the axe these Boshes, 

Run up against fresh horror a well that was not filled in & where we got water for tea & drinking was found to have a dead man in it Part of the body was drawn up in bucket lot of chaps taken ill over it, fortunately we boiled ours. You'd think the Dr would see to these things. 

Raining like blazes & the water dripping in to our crib nice night in front of 

Friday 30/3/17

Sun shining with a shower now & then getting warmer 

Pay 9/7 £23-2-0 

Men started to fill up crater in the Road. 

Our Boys going up to the line about 3 or 4 miles away. Think we stay with B.O.R. 

showers all day. fine night.

Guns going it. fritz retired another 5 miles heard that the French had cut off 45.000 Huns at Alsace-Lorraine front. Rats

Saturday, 31 3 17

Cold wind blowing & cloudy. 

Guns at it all night last night.

Pay 10/7. £23-3-0. 

Just been round what is left of the Village (Bancourt) deep dug-outs everywhere some not finished womens clothes & hats everywhere a Pram is on one of the chimneys; blown up there I suppose & Bottles thousands of them, empty of course. 

Our Pet of Sergnt sits on his hams all day in the canteen what a waster the man is & gets 10/6 a day for it about time he found out theres a war on

Sunday. 1/4/17

Off this morning to Velue. about 7 or 8 miles away. Going to take Village from there tonight good luck to them. the 8th Brigade have taken 2. 

Pay11/7 £23.4.0.

Arrived at Velue about 2 P.M. been pretty Village all amongst Trees but now smashed to Pieces. & A beautiful Chateau the same must have cost anything up to 50,000 The ruins are still smouldering got a Piece of glass from window of church. 

We guard the Ammunitions. 

Monday. 2/4/17

Our Boys took their Village (Doignes) in the early hours this morning but what a mess up it all was. Found that Fritz had wired himself in so had to march another 5 miles & attack through another Village that the 56th were to take this we helped them do; then got to our own on the flank & took it loosing 208 30 Killed the huns ran squeeling like Pigs.

I had to go with Sergt taking Prisoner with us & my shoulders nearly snapped got to head qrts late at night & I had to take Prisoner further on myself just got back & into dug-out when the snipers & the shells started coming over

it simply rained shells all night & one exploded on top of our dug-out, hot, no I was shivering with the cold & fatigue had nothing to eat all day & marched about 15 miles did not sleep a wink & had to lie down with all Equipment on & Boots. Had to take Hun Prisoner our Boys brought in to Buisne about 5 miles away to the MPs no BKs was about done up coming back & only for a Capt of Artillery giving me a nip of whiskey would have laid down to it. 

Lieut Wesly mortally wounded Capt Wilson leg Broken Capt Goldstein wounded twice Lt King wnd & Lt. Horne A lot of our Boys wounded in the elbow. 4 men wounded just opposite me in the Afternoon.

Bitterly cold. Pay 12/7. £23.5.0 

Counter attack tonight,

Tuesday. 3/4/17

The Boys held the Village alright & the worst part of all begins viz collecting the dead. 

The snipers are still busy & have got some of our chaps already 

Passed 5 dead huns on the road we don’t give them time enough to bury them. 

No chance to write letters or get any. 

Pay 13/7. £23.6.0 

up to present have had 1 Piece of Toast. 1 Piece of damper & 2 Pieces of Bread & margarine in 3 days & 1 drink of Tea. 

4. P.M. Just got word that we go out 53rd relieving us go to Velue again. 

Met young Stagg of Tamworth. Knew Mother & Loo. Dvr in 12th field Ambulance. 

C. Sect. off through Bemetz at 8 PM. got to Velue about 10.30. Bread & milk A Tommy gave us Tea on the road here. Rained all the way back.

Wednesday. 4/4/17

been snowing for hours. about 6 or 7 inches deep. & this is spring Anyway the starlings & sparrows are nesting. 

It was a beautiful walk last night our sweet Sgt. half drunk & quarrelsome all the way. He took 3 Pulls at Mr Gardeners Bott without leave, hide enough for anything 

lost 7 officers in the stunt B. Coy took in 160 men came out with 72. 

rain & snow all day. 

Pay. 14/7. £23.7.0.

Thursday. 5/ 4/17 

off to Le Barque up at 7. dread the walk. 11 miles or more. 

fritz slinging shells over us early this morning woke me up. 

Pay 15/7. £23.8.0.

Got here about 4. done up as usual wont be able to stand much more of it. 

Friday. 6/4/17

cloudy & Raining slightly. Plenty of Planes about. also some of fritzs. 

was told we were here for a month & that leave would start

Pay 16/7 £23.9.0 

Bought some Butter F.4. 30 s. cigs. 1.30 Biscuits 3. frs. milk 1.20 Syrup. 2. frs. spend all your money in eatables. 

our ceiling leaking, no roof, all gone

Saturday 7/4/17.

Rained all last night & the water dripped on us no way of stopping it. so put Blanket over head & snore & bore it. 

Snowing this morning a glorious climate no wonder we are cheerful. 2 days ago hot enough for summer now winter again. 

Not feeling too well today 

Pay. 17/7. £23.10.0. 

clear again this Afternoon. 

Sunday. 8/4/17

A Beautiful night last night, full moon. Cloudy this morning but fine & mild, not feeling well yet. 

Pay. 18/7. £23.11.0

mail in got letter from Trustee Coy. telling me of £450 left me. £200 now & £250 when Uncle Jack & Miss Wyndham dies answered it 

letter from Viv also still in Hospital. 

Newton a Major Genr now

Thank goodness theres something waiting for me if I get home

Paid 14/4 Bal owing to me 4/3
Entry.15:
Rain, sleet & snow this morning no two days fine can bet on it

Pay 5/3 £ 23.12-0 

Wrote to Syd & Viv will have to wait till I hear from Nell. 

Terrific Bombardment left of Bapaume this morning 3rd Army going them hell taking Prisoners by the thousands 

Livingston the waster gone to B. Coy as Platoon Sergeant

Tuesday. 10/4/17.

Snowing like blazes inches deep, muster Parade on, out getting the men to it. 

Pay. 6/3. £23.13.0 

3rd army took10.000 Prisoners 100 guns. 

Livingston not gone yet goes tomorrow hurrah rid of the blighter at last.

bitterly cold all day. 

Just had two small Botts stout necta eh what. first for months, haven’t seen a woman or child for 3 months 

letters from Viv. Maude, Nell Jack & Carol 

burnt a bit of my diary though trying to save my grass bed. dam it.

Wednesday. 11/4/17

frost last night snow frozen this morning looks like some more today. 

must write to Maude & Nell today.

Pay 7/3. £23.14.0. 

Off again to the Lord knows where, seems as if leave is cut altogether.

3.30 PM After getting ready & all Packed up sent back to billets 

all sorts of rumours going round about 1st Div being cut off by Huns etc. 5.30 pm snowing hard might move off yet 

Thursday. 12/4/17

Thank Heaven we hadn’t to move last night 6 inches of snow & a strong wind blowing would have been awful. Now waiting for further orders. Sun shining& the snow looks very pretty.

Pay 8/3 £23.15.0 

6.30 P.M. not going up now thank the stars. 

Just heard that Livingston has been telling a lot of lies about me shall have to ring his ugly nose for him.

Friday 13/4/17

Beautiful morning. Sun, nice Breeze Blowing but how long. Band Playing 

Eggs & Bacon Toast & Butter. Eggs 4.20 a dz. Butter 4.30 a tin. 

Pay 9/3. £23.16.0

1. P.M. Heavy clouds & cold wind.
Entry.16:
a nice morning again. one of our lizzies 15" guns on the Railway giving Fritz some hurry up fritz replying with his high Velocity gun 

Pay 10/3. £23.17.0

Wrote to Nell & Viv & posted them 

got clean singlet today wonder they could spare it.

Sunday 15/4/17 

Yanked out at 6. a.m. get ready to move at once fritz attacking 1st Division taken their Village. 

All standing to 8. a.m. expected our spell would be something like this, wonder if there are any other soldiers besides Colonials over here 

Pay
Entry.17:
£23.18 0. 

marched off in the Rain at 9. a.m. got about a mile away when we were ordered to return, went back quicker than we came out. 

6 P.M. fall in full marching order again & off this time no mistake off to Bapaume as reserves. Arrived Bapaume 9. P.M. wet in cellar under ruins. expect to go on guard.
Entry.18:
had a good nights rest after all, no guard work. 

On duty all day Keeping men to their Billets. 

Fritz has taken all the Statues to melt down I suppose, 

fine day but nippy 

more prisoners keep coming in must be nearly 20,000 now lot of them boys 16 & 17. 

Pay
Entry.19:
£23.19.0. 

fritz sends his high Velocity shells over here regularly trying to smash up Railway & Roads. 

Went through the remains of the fine church here nothing left standing, in the Crypt are hundreds of skulls. Got a couple of Pieces of stained glass from window, have Plate from Le Barque & glass from church at Velue.
Entry.21:
£24.0.0 

cold wet & now & then snow. 

Canteen arrived this morning on duty there, all the morning. 

Pike half screwed. 5. P.M. 

suppose we move again tomorrow . Two days in

Shell smashed Bapaume. Where the Town Hall was is a huge mound of Brick & Mortar There were some very large & fine buildings here but not one has escaped should judge it to be a town of anything up to 25,000 People now theres not one to be seen all soldiers. Tommies & Ausis
Entry.22:
Very cold again Rain & Snow, slush & mud 

Guns very busy last night, all quiet now.

should be going back again today 

Pay.
Entry.24:
long journey perhaps Armentaires. hope so. 

letters this afternoon should get some.

having good spell here & plenty to eat but it is not always so. More prisoners this morning.

have been to Picture show just fancy a show here in Bapaume a few weeks ago & even now shells were flopping in to it, such is life, Matty Walker took me.

Nearly Blind with smoke from fire eyes running water & Blood shot, very painful 

to be bed at 9.30.
Entry.25:
at last letters 2 from Nell, 2 cards from Carol letters from Jack & Tony one from Loo & Viv ea. Quite a budget, must answer them to day. 

French & Russians doing well we hear Our guns never cease. 

Leaving here tomorrow for the North some say Belgium. feeding us well so I suppose its Per Boot as usual. 

Carol's Cards caused many a laugh. 

Rumour says we are to be bombarded here tonight, hope not as we leave tomorrow. 

Gas alarm on. 

Letter also from Syd. 

Pay 15/3 £24.2.0
Entry.26:
Wrote to Nell, Maude, Loo, & Viv not posted yet. 

off this morning to Albert, going long journey, not carrying Blankets this time but as we only go about 6 miles today will be cold tonight that however is better than having your shoulders Broken. 

Pay 16/3. £24.3.0 

left Bapaume at 12.30 got here Hot Cross Camp. about 5.30 distance about 11 miles feeling better than on other marches 

but that was because I had no Blankets to carry. Just Bathed my feet in shell hole water & it was some cold feel all the better for it tho. Fellows all in high spirits even after that march they are trying ti kick the inside out of a football 6.30.PM. did not call at Albert so shall not see that historic Town. 

Off again Tomorrow for another 10 or 12 miles then next day through Amiens & 6 Kilos further where we stop. Altogether about 40 miles. It has been a lovely day fortunately for us or the march had it been wet would have been awful as we came across Country part of the way round shell Holes etc.

Saturday. 21/4/17

off again at 10.30 about 14 miles today to Corbie so they say 

A terrific Bombardment was going on North all night & is still going on. Ah fritz retribution is fast upon you.

Cloudy & looks & feels like rain. Arrived here Beurcourt at 2 P.M. about 8 miles & my feet were just giving out also shoulders & I was not the only one. 

Rained slightly & turned very cold has every appearance of snow again 

we are on the Somme again but move 
up
 on again in two days. 

Get a long felt want tomorrow A Bath & clean linnen vz underwear. 

The French & British have given fritz hell this week & no error anxiously waiting to hear about last night & this morning. heard that 20 divisions were going over.

Sunday 22/4/17

freezingly cold wind blowing big church Parade a Brigade affair. 

Bath today I hope. 

Pay 15/3. £24.5.0.

Cold water shave & wash, cold gee whiz. 

Here for a week rumours that we go to Salonika. 

Funny life this the other day dodging shells now playing football & cricket as if there was not such a thing as war. 

Got hair cut. 

Monday 23/4/17.

freezing wind again but fine, guns going it all night & at it yet. 

Pay 19/3 £24.6.0

went to see the charred Cross. This is a huge cross with I.R.N.I. in letters on the top of it as representing our Saviour. On this cross a sutty was nailed & burnt so they tell me here The cross & near by trees are certainly charred & burnt. I would not put it past the devils. 

A Taube dropped some bombs not far from us this morning. 

Wrote & Posted letters to Maude, Loo Syd & Viv. & Nell.

Tuesday 24/4/17

Fine & a little warmer getting pleasant now & just about time. 

Anxac Day tomorrow. All kinds of sports & competitions.

Pay 20/3 £24.7.0.

Getting plenty to eat & a liberal dose of rum at night. Am feeling well again & a few weeks of this will make a new man of me.

have saved 100 francs & get paid again today. 

No word of leave. Yes 2 gone on leave this morning ought to get mine soon now. 

Paid 20 Frs. 14/4 Bal. 5/11.

every one polishing up & getting ready for tomorrow. Just got a new Pr of Pants first since Sept 7/15 what with Boots Polished clean clothes Hat (felt) stiffened up (with water) & cleaned & fastened up at the side, we don’t know ourselves.

Also Bands playing you'd think there was no war on. 

3rd Army Pushed the huns up north where we were so long advanced 1500 yds on 20 mile front & took 2000 Prisoners. Huns on this front done another bunk. retired.
Entry.27:
Anxac Day all is bustle & cleaning up shaving, cleaning Boots, Brass, Harness limbers & Cookers for the sports & competitions. 

Cloudy but fine so far cool wind blowing. 

Very heavy gun fire early this morning away to the right think the French must have gone over. 

Pay 5/11. deferred £24.8.0

Have made error in pay the above is correct mistake again. 

C Coy won the contest for best squad A Coy
Entry.28:
D. & B also ran. 

Latest is that we are off to Salonica or Egypt.

Turned bitterley cold this afternoon 

C. Coy won 9 events out of 15. 

glad to get to bed to get warm, no fire.
Entry.29:
Still Cold & cloudy. 

Came a cropper this morning, ordered out to drill with the Band for about 2 hours. 

getting a bit hot, on duty all day, now drill also think Ill go back to the Coy.

Pay
Entry.30:
def. £24.9.0. 

no word of leave yet

believe we are off to Egypt soon. 

Turned out warmer the wind having dropped a bit & the sun got a chance. 

letter from Viv. Wrote to Mr Parsons not posted yet.
Entry.31:
Cloudy & like rain & warmer .

Terrific Bombardt all night on left of Bapaume. Germans getting hell. 

drill again this morning. 

Going into Albert this afternoon at 3. 

Bombardment still going on. 

Went to Albert at 3.30. fine Town & not so smashed up as say Bapaume the fine Cathedral as usual being the most knocked about. This was a beautiful 

building with a Bell Tower & on top a statue of the Virgin & child weighing 6 tons this was hit at the base & fell overhanging the street an awesome sight to walk under, its about 300 feet from the ground. It was secured in its Present Position by Aux Engineers. but in my opinion will come down one of these days the strain on the Brick work being awful . 

Saw some women & children first for about 3½ months also shops etc, some of the people have chanced it & come back again but they have a look about them that is not pleasant & no wonder. 

Got home again about 8.15. Bombardment still going on.
Entry.32:
fine & getting warmer, quite close last night 

Bombardment still going on heavily.

getting inoculated again today. What for no one knows.

Giving in sheep-skin vests & spare blanket. 

Pay 8/11. £24.11.0. 

Wish I had got some souvenirs from Albert but too expensive.
Entry.33:
A Beautiful morning sun hot quite like Ausi again. 

Going to Dr about my Kidneys had no sleep for 4 nights

Inoculated yesterday arm very Painful all day & night a bit better this morning. Dr giving me linament to rub into back may as well give me pepermint lollies.

Posted letter to Viv & Mr Parsons two papers came from Mr Parsons yesterday. 

Pay 9/11 £24.12.0 

Been very hot all day just like Sydney Butter & tinned cheese melted, 

no sounds of guns must have advanced a lot. 

Feeling very crook from inoculation all the Boys the same.
Entry.34:
beautiful morning not as hot as yesterday nice breeze blowing, drill but we are out of it now that the Band is disbanded. 

Up on the Road about ¾ of a mile away is the biggest crater in france about 80 ft deep & 300 ft in circumference must have been a mine but whether one of ours or fritzs don’t know. 

The last place we stopped at got the first sight of a Tank & Trailer no wonder fritz got frightened. 

letter from Jack & Carol yesterday. 

Pay
Entry.35:
£24.13.0.

Terrific Battle going on may decide things the huns sacrificing their best Troops trying to stop us.

Just voted for the ministerialists hope they get in. (have gon got chits no scabies) 

Football matches. Brigade Band playing Divisl sports start almost at once.

After that off to Ypres or Armentires. 

Got Pr of Sox from Nell 

no letters. 

Reinforcements came to day should not wonder if we moved off Tomorrow.
Entry.36:
A nice fine day, a bit cold, strong wind blowing from the north, can hear the guns going it, that is the heavies. 

Divisional inspection & sports tomorrow great activity cleaning up limbers, cookers, etc.

Pay 11/11. £24.14.0 

Some going on leave today lucky devils I may get away before Xmas. 

letter from Nell about the best I have received, a bit more feeling in it I am glad to say. 

Inspection by the General Tomorrow. All men except 4 in the Batallion 150 Rounds of ammunition to carry as well as full Pack.
Entry.37:
Fine day, cool wind blowing up at 5 shave etc find the review is put off. 

Pay 12/11 £24.15.0 

Glad to get under cover sun very Hot Queer weather this wrote to Nell. 

Got a new Boss Ta Ta Livingstone.

Paid 20 francs 14/8

French money has gone up. Stand now deferred Pay £24.17.0 owes me 3/1 this is correct & in hand 104 francs & a half £3.14.10 2/5
Entry.38:
forgot pm yesterday am writing this on Friday.

Great scare, got orders to stand by to go to the front again, at 4 P.M. but it was a false alarm the 2nd div. held what they had taken so we wern’t wanted

Weather keeps fine & if the wind dyed down would be hot.

Pay 4/1 def £24.18.0

Gee whiz food does run away with your money.
Entry.39:
A lovely morning same old wind with us yet.

Boys very lively owing to not having to go in again div sports tomorrow

Pay 5/11 £24.19.0.

letter from Viv. wrote Jack Carol Tony & Nell.
Entry.40:
cloudy but fine hot night but cool in the early morning took off underpants.

wrote Viv.

Pay 6/1 £25.0.0

5. P.M. been very hot like summer in Sydney these last 2 days & only about 10 days ago were shivering round fires. Truly a remarkable climate.

We had 2 firsts & 1 second at the sports. not so bad when considered that competitions were open to 4th & 5th Army.

Am living very high 1 tin of Salmon 1½ francs 1 tin of Peaches 1½ francs for Tea tonight wont have much left for Blighty at this rate.

Seems funny our having sports & a few miles away others are being blown to atoms 

in hand 91 francs about £3.6.9.

looks like storm wind getting up & turning cold.
Entry.41:
A bitterly cold night & again this morning. Yesterday men getting about with only Pair of shorts on, to day – overcoats.

Pay 7/1 £25.1.0. 

been very cold all day & the sun shining. 

Inspection by Genrl. tomorrow.
Entry.42:
Another surprise off to Bapaume again by Train then Per Boot to God knows where 

a hell of a Battle going on guns going for all they are worth we are into it this time with a Vengeance I wonder if this is to be the end. 

Pay 8/1. deferred £25.2.0. 

53 & 56th have gone we expect to leave at 9. 

was up at 4.30 a.m. On board train 11.30 a.m. left 12.15 through Miroumont. desolation & Tommies Arrived about 4 PM tired & dusty, came through Bapaume & other Villages & Towns but did not get their names. Plenty of them about here & they don't appear in the distance to be smashed but suppose they are. 

if the huns make a big counter attack tonight into it we go & as the fighting is awful God knows if you will come out of it alive. The Big guns about 400 yds away are kicking up blazes & the others are like machine guns.
Entry.43:
Rained all night, slept in tents, woke up this morning swimming for dear life inside as wet as outside So got up & did what we should have done yesterday, dug a trench (fastening the stable door after the horse got out). Owing to the rain there wasn’t much doing but the guns are still banging away.

Pay. 9/1. £25.3.0.

Rained all the morning & of course nothing but mud again. Hot as blazes yesterday, cold to day. 

off to the line this evening, guns going it

lef at 8:15 arrived 2 a.m. nearly a gonner twice once coming through Boulingcourt a shell burst in a ruined house alongside the Road & a Piece of brick came down on my helmet. good old tin hat, the other was here, men just going to get into dug-out when shell landed 3 yds away on the other side of the sunken lane thought we were all gone but I only got small splinter in the side of the knee & my face covered with phosforus, 

One man wounded & my mate got a hit in the neck & face a very close shave & am looking at the shell hole while I write this & wondering how we escaped, had a hot time all the way in & the noise was fearful, hundreds of guns firing from our side also fritzs. 

Marched almost 8 or 10 miles but in Battle order no Packs. Had to sit up all night no room to lie down three of us in dug-out. shells still passing over us. 

Owing to the rain the Roads are awful & the mud like glue. hope we get out alright.

Just before getting here fell down a 15 ft. trench & the old tin hat saved me from smashing my head, "Oh it was a bosker night.
Entry.44:
Stand to at 4 a.m. till 5 but nothing doing our fellows went right into front line & we are here for 48 hours. 

A beautiful day; sun shining again 

not too safe outside the dug-out. Any way we are in the Hindeberg line & the trench I fell down was his front line. 

Pay 10/1 pounds 25.4.0. 

Nearly had the use for Pay Books finished last night it was a hell of a time & no error.

It was Pike Peterson who was wounded last 

night got it in the arm also three others one of the A.M.C fellows was one of them. 

fairly quiet today only artillery fire. Tonight will be the usual thing I suppose though they say fritz is blowing up the Village he is in & is on the retire again. 

9. P.M. the guns have started their infernal din again just getting dark.
Entry.45:
had an awful night & a wonderful escape A shell burst in exactly the same place as the night before & a piece of it set a bag of bombs off that were on top of our little dug-out the din was fearful & the smoke also thought it was all up this time & expected the D-O. to fall in. However nothing happened but I don’t want any more as close as that. 

Ltn Gardiner & 3 men were killed in a dug-out in the same way so we must consider ourselves fortunate. The two shells have made a nice hole opposite so if another comes tonight it will go a bit farther in. 

A beautiful morning again & not a gun on either side firing, quite a relief, but not for long I think as a lot of our Planes are up over us. 

Got no sleep of course had 3 gas alarms. 

just had a look where bombs went off Rifles are smashed Bayonettes are Broken & all along the side of the road, is eaten with holes surely a special providence is looking after us to escape being hit last night & they tell me its far worse down the front line, this is supports. 

Have to go for Rations 9.30. back to Village of Vaux. 

Pay 11/1 £25.5.0
Entry.46:
Well last night was the limit, started off at 10 in the dark, fellows like stuck rabbits thought they hadn’t a minute to live so got over the ground for all they were worth, being all young men, soon left me behind. Shells were bursting on our left all the way. Got to my old stumbling block the Trench which I fell into & safely got over this time but on the other side not a soul was to be seen, so I had to plug along on my own & didn’t for the life of me know where I was going or when I would fall into a shell crater, however after much cursing, sweating & yelling to the others I got there at last. I called them all the scared ninnies I could think of 

Got our Bags of Rations & a tin of water & off again hadn’t gone hundred yards when head over heels I went water one way & Rations another Rifle another & helmet the same. I didn't say anything "Oh no" smiled ever so sweetly & said dear me "I don’t think". up again & through the shell zone again arriving safely, Just prior to this 6 of the 53rd were knocked out at the well one killed. 

delivered the goods & turned in 12.30 just getting a snooze up when we were called out again to take Rations up to head Quarters six yds up. did so after some more "dear me’s" & then turned in at 2.30. We went over land & not through the Trenches & it was a wonder we were not spotted & shelled. Hadn't been in more than half an hour when Fritz started & didn't he pump shells into this Place, wonderful how any one lives through it 

Today fine & hot Planes over us & the air craft guns are going strong. Forgot to 

mention that when we got back from getting Rations, were called out to bring Ltn Gardiner in he had his head blown off so when we found that he was being brought in were not sorry. 

Some chaps wounded just same near us, a shell exploded just near the top of our dug-out. 

Been very hot today quite Ausi weather & this evening is lovely, not many guns, seems quite Peaceful. 

Major Cain got one through the foot, out of action. Jess Smith his Batman (now a corporal) has gone with him. 

off for Rations again tonight. 

Pay 12/1 25/6/-
Entry.47:
Terrific Bombardment started about 9.p.m. Scotties & the 57th ours went over & took a position & in the middle of it all we set out for the Rations & it was hell, you couldn’t hear the shells coming for the awful din so when we got to the next Trench we stayed there until it lulled a bit then on & got lost in the Village for 3/4 of hour too dark to get your bearings, got them at last, loaded up double load this time & started off, was just turning into a Ruined building when 4 fritz's shells came in one after the other 20 seconds later or sooner & the lot of us would have gone up, Truly I am having some narrow escapes this time & hope with all my heart that my good fortune continues.

After this got home alright with the sweat pouring out of us. 
woke
 12.30. woke up to an even worse Bombardment Fritz counter attacked & kept it up for 3 hours but no go we are still in Possession & got 157 Prisoners We had a lot of casualities also but fritz must have got hell. They are bringing out the wounded now & our Planes are very busy. so are the chats. 

the Village taken last night was Builingcourt. Very Hot again & plenty of artillery fighting. off for more Rations,. 

Pay 13/1 £25.7.0
Entry.48:
Another exciting night again but not so full of danger as privously, got over for the Rations earlier so could see where we were going & it’s the better Plan. Had to take some up to Head Quarters later on in the dark how I hate the dark my eyes are not as good as they were & am always in a funk that I shall fall down some deep shell hole & get hurt one doesn’t want that sort of hurt over here. Got back safely soaked through with sweat, very sultry weather. 

Go out to the supports tonight. Fritz counter attacked again this morning about 3 don’t know how he got on this time. The Scotties took 400 Prisoners yesterday & the 15th Brigade 157. 

The Bombardment was terrific while it lasted but everything is quietened down a bit now, always does when our Planes get up there are about 30 up now & they have the hun bluffed, scarcely ever see any of his. Some rumours that fritz is evacuating in front of us. 

Pay14/1 £25.8.0
Entry.49:
came out last night & not likely to forget it. Huns must have got wind of it & an infernal Bombardment started which beat anything yet & that’s saying something, our Posi was shelled for 2 or 3 hours & it was quite dark & Raining when we got away, with that creepy feeling you get when the shells come behind you. Got here Norreil at about 11.30. & the shells were bursting all round this place owing to Batteries being near. What a night it was I have had my fill & wish I was out of it, have had 6 days & nights 

continuous shelling & carrying Rations 3/4 of a mile through it in the dark to make the noise more appaling a terrific thunderstorm came on about 1 oclock this with the guns made it seem like hell let loose. Thank God we are alive this morning & may go back another 2 miles today, though doubtful as the Brigade is in till Wednesday. 

This morning is fine but thunder is about & looks like another storm. 

Pay 15/1 £25.9.0 

This Village like all others is a mass of ruins. Laid on the floor in the dust of a ruined house right under shell fire but did not get any sleep. Our Canteen is here so got some cake 2 francs Biscuits 1 F. cigs 6d leaves me 76 francs. £2.15.8.

Rained on & off to day & this afternoon had some shells very close to us, never seems safe even when out of Trenches. 

Much cooler to-night.
Entry.50:
I can hardly believe I am alive this morning after the awful time last night commencing at 9 P.M & finishing about 6 a.m today. All ideas of Fritz being short of amunition was rudely dispelled for the Rain & hail of shells during that time beggars description & of course they took their Toll. Among the first being our corporal (Birch of Goulbourne) & Percy Peacie my mate Birch killed outright & Peacie badly wounded a third of the shells were gas shells & I had my Helmet on & off hundreds of times. It out did Fromelles & thats all there is to say about it except the marvellous good fortune that is mine. The night before I was in the same place with those two but owing to rain shifted to

another posi / otherwise – had to leave this owing to the constant warning of gas & not daring to go to sleep so joined some other fellows in another part of the ruined house & there I sat on the floor all night expecting every second to be blown to atoms but altho they came alongside of us, at us & round us none hit us after the one that got my two chums till daylight when feeling cramped I got up & walked into the next room 

had just got into it when a shell came into the room where I had been, walked out of this room & the same thing happened a shell came into the room I had just left amongst a lot of men wounding some I then went out to the place when I had taken my things to to see if it had been blown down & no sooner got there when another shell came through at the corner, that was enough 

I went for an early morning stroll up the road away from the shells & after getting my nerves a bit steady made to come back when crossing what was once a railway line a whiz Bang just missed my head by ducking & landed about 10 yards away. Some of the boys say I am not born to be killed by shells & there is no get away from it, I am lucky, & never thanked God for life so fervently. There seems some guiding force behind me when danger is near at all events so it seems to me. 

Am now in charge of the Police & have just had a sweet job looking for some men. saw several wounded whilst doing it 

what to night will bring forth, one can only surmise by the quietness of to day like yesterday that we are in for a repetition of last nights business I sincerely hope not as my nerves are getting jumpy under this terrible shell fire. This morning I was thoroughly unnerved & fit for nothing as were all of us. Am the only one in the Police left now two new men to report today 

Pay 15/1 £25.10.0. 

We lost a lot of men last night & so did Fritz when he tried to come over in massed formn. our Artillery was waiting for him so you can guess the rest. The German dead are heaped up in front of our lines 

came over in waves.
Entry.51:
The huns have run or evacuated or retired one of these & the result a good nights rest free from horror & no one wanted it more than I did hardly closed my eyes for, (at night time) a week. A few shells came over last night & smashed up some more of the smashed village & now he is gone back to another strong ridge at Cambrai five miles, but we’ll hunt him out of that also. 

Pay 16/1 £25.11.0. 

The Posi I was going to sleep in last night, but changed my mind about 6 PM, had a huge wall blown down during the evening. Reported since that fritz has not gone back so far, if at all still the Tommies went over this morning & found he had left their sector. Pretty quiet again today Percy Peacie had about 20 wounds small ones & the Corporal Birch had his throat

cut by a piece of shell. Poor chap last I saw of him he was watching the Signallers playing cards now he is buried.
Entry.52:
Been much quieter altho a good few shells came over yesterday afternoon & last night some of them gas. Take it all round there was not anything out of the ordinary except that they came from one quarter only viz on the left. so that it is probable that he is retiring one sector at a time. There are expectations that we are to be relieved tonight but nothing definite, the sooner the better. 

Pay 17/1 £25.12.0

Our chaps were out souvenir Hunting yesterday getting watches rings etc. 

have written Viv & Maude have to Post them also one for Nell, Jack, Carol Tony & Will Stewart & Syd 

Wet & Cold these last two days.
Entry.53:
Fritz got pleasant again last night & treated us to gas again but we are up to all those silly dodges now & it cuts no ice didn't last long so had a good nights rest. 

fine this morning tho cloudy & warmer. 

Pay. 18/1. £25,13.0. 

Our planes were out early this morning so we might learn where he is not been able to go up for 2 days. Our boys going in again to night seems as if we will never get out of this hell of a Place the fiercest fighting of the war is going on here at Bullencourt, 
This
 village is called Noreuil & to our Right is Langnicourt. 

Fritz shelling us again big stuff 8 in 

Jack Nelson wounded just now about 25 yards away. Promises to be a lively night.
Entry.54:
my prediction was correct it was a lively night shelled us with heavies for 5 hours & came mighty close to my Posi. Lt. Jimmie Kerr was killed Sergt Jack Nelson wounded & many others its time they came to their senses & moved us out of this death trap.

The Boys took 3 days Rations so as not to have to come out for them every night. 

fine but cloudy & chilly, during all the 5 hrs Bombt. last night our guns never replied with a shot. ‘Why’ I wonder. 

Planes very busy this morning, can’t find Fritzs big guns tho. here for another 7. days yet, we 
must
 be the only army in France, every road you go & every track is marked with Blood, smashed helmets & Rifles & equipment if Fritz is getting it as the Papers say he is, what must it look like on his side. I shall be more than thankful when we get out of this & still more so 
when
 I get my leave 

Just watching some of our Planes when first one & then another began to fall turning over & over from Tail & head then over sideways. thought they were gonners but bless you they were giving us an exhibition & for cool front they were the limit, almost over Fritzs lines too it’s bucked us up wonderfully for if thats their opinion of Fritz & they can see him, enough said. 

Pay 19/1 £25.14 0
Entry.55:
another quiet night thank goodness 

slight Rain & mist also this morning hot & fine 

saw great Plane fight just now as far as I could see none came down but it was a great sight & just over head they looked just like giant birds wheeling & diving, flying sideways & 

swooping up again firing all the time there must have been about 10 or 12 of them but how many of each could not tell, it was too quick & exciting, There seems little danger of these new monsters falling they fly anyhow & at any angle. come to think of it, its a wonder the two of us weren’t hit as we were just under them, but you don’t think of these things till after. 

Am hoping to be named to go to blighty today some went last Sunday 

suppose tonight will be a repetition of last sundays straffing. Must have been a hop over on our left last night a barrage was put up about 8 P.M. 

Pay. 20/1 £25.15.0
Entry.56:
dull & like rain 

fairly quiet last night, can't make it out something is in the wind, must be a big attack our Planes very busy. 

Some of our chaps coming out tonight. 

Pay. 21/1 £25.16.0. 

Been quiet all day except for some Artillery exchanges now 6.30 pm. 

Brigade goes out tomorrow, thank heavens. 

Been playing Patience these last two days nothing to do & all day to do it in bit different last week. Expect we have a nice old tramp in front of us.
Entry.57:
Rained all night, heavy firing on Both sides think it another hop over. Go out to night. 

Pay. 22/1. £25.17.0. 

only a rumour about going out, coming out of Trenches but only into reserves, more rain coming ,dull.
Entry.58:
fine & warm but cloudy fairly quiet a bit of a Barrage put up last night about 9. but what for don't know. 

Jack Nelson died yesterday also Kanan, must write about Jack. 

my leave is nearly due now owing to all the rest having had theirs. 

Pay. 23/1/ £25.18.0. 

Going out in two days time to Beaulincourt. 

Keeping fine & sun hot 5 p.m. Been fairly quiet all day 

Wrote too soon about it being quiet had to go for our lives twice put 8 inch shells all round our dug-out in fact all over the place & what a crash they do make came back after 2 hrs expecting to see our place buried, but altho covered with dirt & bricks no harm done hope he does not start again to night. 2 or 3 hours of that lasts a long time.
Entry.59:
Night passed off quietly except for artillery exchanges. 

A Beautiful morning clear sky with a few clouds floating over, guns banging away in spasms nothing defenite. 

Just washed my feet had shave, cleaned Boots Ye Gods fancy cleaning your Boots in a place like this, but hate to be dirty. 

Expect the Boys will chiak me over it. 

Pay. 24/1. £25.19.0 

wish that leave would hurry up. 

Sent the gas over in cylinders to Fritz about 2 a,m & sent in the heavy stuff must have given him a shaking up. 

had to leave our dug-out, put a gun about 6yds away from us & near the entrance; first shot thought my head was gone, but it wasn't long before I left to them entirely, am in one I found this afternoon, not bad.
Entry.60:
A Beautiful morning clear & fine sun hot. 

Put over gas again last night & Frit’z horns were going some have not heard of results from the two nights gas Pay him back for that gas shell Bombardment he gave us from 9 PM. to 5 a.m. 

Artillery very busy to day, expect to go out some time tonight off to Baileu so I am told. should get my leave from there. 

Pay 25/1/ deferred £26.0-0. in hand 71 francs £2.11.1. 

Packed up & waiting to move 8 P.M. sun just going down 

going to Feveul the Place we left to come here, all tents there. About 8 to 10 miles with full Pack up. 

Shells 8" coming over very close.
Entry.61:
Thank God we are out of that horror of a death trap at last left about 10.30 last night 2 of us & headed straight up death Valley with full Pack up & a hot night to cheer us on with sweat pouring out of us. 

Got clear away to Vaux with out getting shelled had Tea & a cake at the Y.M.C.A. then on again .Got about a mile when a limber caught us up & we got a ride to here & we got a ride to here Feveuil arriving at about 1. a.m, full of thankfulness for our escape, some of the Boys were hit & some killed coming out they nearly all got here about 2.30. so no sleep all night. 

A Taube came over to Bomb us at day break but the anti guns drove him off 

he got 12 the other morning 3 killed. 

Going to Boulingourt about 5 Kilos away at 2. P.M. After which don’t know, this

Place full of Tommies & Ausy’s. There is a wood just near us & it looks lovely every shade of green in it & one of Fritz's Grave Yards there also. 

Am told we are giving the huns a bad time & if its any worse than I have been through they are welcome to it. 

Pay. 26/1 £26.1.0.

Sunday 27/5/17. 

A Beautiful morning nice Breeze blowing chilly during the night. 

Got here at 7. P.M (Beaulingcourt) last night. Big camp Just outside Baupaume . 

Even here fritz has a gun shelling the Road from 18 miles Back.

Getting Paid today Pay 27/1 £26.2.0.

feel much better for the night’s rest 

letter from Viv last night sent Parcel to him. Letter from Nell & Jack Posted letters to Jack, Tony, Carol, Nell, Syd, Viv, Maude & Will Stewart

Monday. 28/5/17

A lovely morning, very little gun fire going on or they are too far away to hear them 

8th Brig. 30th Batt lost 11 men killed in Bapaume yesterday Fritz shelling from 18 miles away. 

forgot to mention that I am in charge of Police again from 16/5/17. C.O's orders this morning Got 3 men under me now. 

Paid 20 francs yesterday. Pay now owing to me is 13/5 defd. 26.3.0.

Tuesday 29/5/17/

Thunder storm last night cool & cloudy to day heavy gun fire all night. 

Going out farther back in two days. Came out on orders last night 

am a Lance Corporal at last. Got the stripe up 

R.SM gone on Leave to Blighty.

Must write Viv. 

Pay 14/5. def. 26.4.0.

got my other 2 men to day am now set, Livingstone in Blighty
Entry.62:
gone on leave to day. 

Just got new Tunic & colours also stripe. "eh what."
Entry.63:
Cool & cloudy but fine, 

Just heard that Viv has been boarded by the Drs & sent home to Ausy. hope its true & good luck to him. 

Hear that Austria is seeking a separate Peace, hope so. 

Fenton & Hankinson the new men began yesterday on duty.

Pay.
Entry.64:
£26.5.0. 

had a bath & clean change yesterday & what a treat after the vermin & sweat covered shirts & how they did Pong. its a great life. 

A little rain this afternoon thundery weather. 

Cant get a late Paper so don’t know how the war is going. 

Going on a 90 mile march in a day or so to Alberville can see a lot not finishing.
Entry.65:
lovely morning cool & nice Breeze. 

A terrific Barrage put up last night all along the line & another this morning early must have been attack & counter. 

lots of Parties going away to school 

Pay.
Entry.66:
def. £26.6.0.

Been a lovely day, no letters.
Entry.67:
A glorious morning, France at her best marred by the Presence of two Taubes cruising overhead. 

Boys just gone but some on fatigue & some to drill leaving here either tomorrow or Sunday. 

Pay 17/5 £26.7.0
Entry.68:
another fine morning warm means Hot day 

heavy gun fire on our left 

Pay 18/5. £26.8.0. 

Been Raining this afternoon now cold enough for a fire 

Boxing on at 54th lines 

cricket & football here.
Entry.69:
A very cold night but a beautiful morning, church Parade, 

Heavy fighting all night 

rumours that Tommie’s took Quent. 

Fritzs planes over head this morning. Shelling Bapaume 

Pay 19/5 £26.9.0. 

no word of leave yet & no letters. 

Seems rummy to be called Corp now. 

Had an exciting time exactly at ¼ to 10 PM.

Bugles sounded lights out when there was a rush in the air & Bang about 20 yds behind my Tent. One of fritzs Bombs from a Taube. Got 5 wounded one of them being one of my mates a Bugler there were 3 of us in the Tent at the time & what a scatter it was laughable to see them going for their lives away from the Tents however he only dropped one more & that about 400 yds away.

Had it landed amongst the Tents a lot would have gone out as the charge seemed to open out on the ground like a fan & would have caught you even if you were lying down. 

The Sergeants had a narrow escape 10 of them were standing up in their mess & the Tarpauline was riddled. A lot of Taubes were up & the guns were blazing at them. I hear they got one at Bapaume.
Entry.70:
The night passed off quietly our Planes were up all night so fritz kept away expect he will visit us again to night. 

This morning same as yesterday, lovely is no name for it, life is worth living in this weather. 

Sent letter to Nell yesterday addressed it G.P.B. Sydney. 

Pay 20/5 £26.10.0 

Been very hot today 8. P.M. expect fritz will be over again tonight. 

Big route March tomorrow about 10 miles.
Entry.71:
Kept very sultry till about 12 last night then got cool, glorious full moon, beautiful morning & going to be hot again

Route march at 9. till 1. 

Fritz did not come over last night our Planes were waiting for him. 

Marched about 7 miles & as hot as Sydney in summer but it did us good 

The Taubes were up again tonight but did not get this far. 

Pay 21/5 £26.11.0
Entry.72:
felt a bit stiff this morning, same kind of weather as yesterday, tried to rain early but cleared off. 

Terrific Bombardment going on last night & still going on; its on all along the line from Cambrai to Ypres. 

Saw that Brazil is now in it surely it can’t last much longer.

Wrote to Jack Tony & Carol this morning. 

Got new Pants & Boots half soled so am looking decent again.

Pay 22/5 £26.12.0.

Thunderstorm to night so no Taubes.
Entry.73:
lovely Morning, did not rain much but cooled the air, going to be hot today.

7 of our Blighters to be Court Martialed today, means 3 & 5 years for some of them The cat wouldn’t do two of them any harm, foul mouthed brutes. 

Am going to play cricket this afternoon will suffer for it tomorrow. 

Pay. 23/5 £26.13.0 

sent letters to Mrs Parsons & Jack Tony & Carol. 

have had one letter since coming out, that is one other letter – from Nell since May 1st. the last May 27th & yet they tell me they write once a week. 

Had a game of cricket this Afternoon 2nd for 15 yrs made Top score & got 5 wickets the old un isn’t a back no. yet

Nice & cool this evening. 

Div. Concert on to night.
Entry.74:
Route March again today 10 miles full Pack up, that’s it, come out for spell & get your inside walked off, ass is no name for it, 

great fighting going on big Push at Ypres. 

Beautiful morning got back about 12.15 started 8.15. done up. Heat awful also dust, nearly fell out. 

Beer in to day, some of the boys will be tight tonight. 

Got fearfully stiff must have been the cricket the day before. 

looks like heavy rain, & the guns going it, big barrage about 5 P.M. 

No word of leave yet. 

Pay 24/5 £26.14.0
Entry.75:
Thunderstorm last night & heavy rain for a while, but fine this morning & cooler though cloudy,

Guns still flopping them in, Fritz must be enjoying himself. I don’t think. 

Great victory up a Ypres12.000 Prisoners up to last night. expect of hear of something like that down here in todays Paper. 

Getting paid today. £26.15.0. 25/5.

No leave for A Coy on Tuesday so am out of it again am afraid I shall never get to Blighty. 

feel very stiff this morning but not so bad as last night. 

Letter from Maude also Paper yesterday wants loan of £10.0.0. 

Concert tonight.
Entry.76:
Big change fog, cold & like rain, got letter from Viv last night. 

got new Hat & Boots set now.

Pay to day Pay. 26/5 £26-16.0.

leaving Tomorrow am told suppose its Ypres or thereabouts. 

Posted letters to Nell, Maude, Loo & Viv. 

Paid 14/8 Bal. 11/9 

got very Hot again, means more rain.
Entry.77:
Have seen some thunderstorms but last nights was the limit it was terrific started about 3 a.m. & is still going 8 a.m. the lightening was the worst I have seen & the thunder like a million batteries of 12" going off at once seemed as if two storms had met as it came from 2 seporate directions. The dust of yesterday is somme mud again. 

Not leaving to day but Wednesday. 

Pay. 12/9. £26.17.0.
Entry.78:
17

A lovely morning, going to be hot, Cold night last night. Should have been on my leave to day. 

ground dried up again Plenty of gun fire all day yesterday. Expect to go tomorrow

Pay 13/9. £26.15.0. Wrote to Syd.
Entry.79:
Route March, up at ¼ to 5 shave, BK, & off at 7.30. 10 miles, New Boots, home again at 11 blistered heels & half crippled. curse these Route marches. 

Rumour that Ausy’s don’t go into Trenches any more & that Peace is very near. Next. 

Pay. 14/9. £26.19.0. 

Been a lovely day not as hot as the other march, Cool tonight.
Entry.80:
Cool morning but getting warm, off Tomorrow by Train, heel not so painful, & not stiff this time. 

Pay. 15/9. £27.0.0.

going to Millincourt 9. a.m. Friday. 

Big battle last night heavy firing all along line from Arras to Peronne.
Entry.81:
Gas alarm at 1 a.m. up at 5 off to Millincourt go to Bapaume then Train. about 20 miles then march about 6 miles back to billets again. 

Hot this morning. 

Pay 16/9 £27.1.0. 

Marched through smashed up Bapaume. After being messed about for 1/2 hour got into train & am still on it not moved off yet about 2 hours. 

Taube Bombed the line half an hour before we embarked still here 2.30 P.M. since 11 am off at last 5.30. 7 Bombs were dropped on line. 

out of train 6.15. marched 7 miles, feet blistered, Toes & heels skinned curse the marches. 

Got here Millincourt 9 P.M. done up.
Entry.82:
On duty early, got another man 5 of us now so ought to be able to manage. 

Plenty of beer & wine here & drunks 

saw the first women & kids yesterday for 6 months.

This village hardly knocked about at all though there are trenches all round it.

Got the boys to bed all right not much trouble. 

Pay
Entry.84:
very hot just like Sydney in Jany. Got the two extremes here. 

Got letter from Syd & Trustee Coy. also Parcel from Nell. Tasmania.
Entry.87:
cannot get leave yet so (umpty.)

letter from Viv, Broke, so am I, can sympathise with him.

Pay 22/9 £27.7.0.

sweet place this no Money & no Pay for 9 days may as well have kept us in the line.
Entry.88:
Nothing much doing Boys in C Coy going out to day for stunt, taking Village, Pictures I expect. 

Pay 23/9 £27.8.0
Entry.89:
same every day. all chaps Broke, no money, no Booze, good behaviour.

Bat. gone out on stunt this morning 

must write to Viv to day, also Nell & Boys.

Pay 24/9 £27.9.0. 

Bully Beef stew every day, can’t come at it at all.
Entry.90:
Glorious morning

3rd Brigade went through on their way to the front again expect we go soon. 

nothing important, sent letters to Viv & Nell. 

Pay 25/9 £27.10.0.

Post Cards to Jack Carol, Tony Nell. letter to Trustee Coy for £10-0-0 ought to get it end of August. 

been lovely day getting warm again. 

Pay Tomorrow.
Entry.91:
Warm cloudy morning nice Breeze. My friend Murray the Pug has returned. 

We are about 2 miles from Albert here & can see the Cathedral & hanging, statue quite plain. Also Posierers where the Ausys mad a name for themselves Met some of them yesterday & they told me all about it. 

Plenty of Villages all round here & untouched. The only shell that came into this one hit the house where our officers mess is. 

Pay 26/9 £27.11.0. 

getting deadly monotonous, no money, can't but anything spent 70 francs on food since coming out & were wining.
Entry.92:
Pay. 27/9 £27.12.0.

nothing else except a Robbery at a Pub
Entry.93:
Pay. 28/9. £27.13-0

on duty.last night till nearly 1. got to get the lights out did not get out this morning till 11. 

Nothing doing can’t go into Amiens no money could have gone 2 or 3 times but –
Entry.94:
Wrote to Mrs Parsons, Maude & Syd 

fine but stormy 

got 4 new men on Police.

Pay 29/9 £27.14.0.

only two men to go before me to blighty. 

heavy storm, lightening very vivid & close & very heavy rain 

Pay Books collected Pay on Saturday.
Entry.95:
W. Holman due to day to review us 

beautiful morning, fresh but cloudy 

Pay.
Entry.96:
£27.15.0.

Jones went on leave yesterday. 

this day 12 months arrived in France have seen some things since then.

Party of Hun Prisoners just gone Past big men all of them but what dials they have hog all over it. road mending is their Job.
Entry.97:
This day last year was in Railway carriage on our way up from Marsailles 

Cold & miserable, scotch mist & windy 

Premier Holman reviewed Boys yesterday. Told them they would have to do Plenty of fighting yet. 

Pay.
Entry.98:
£27.16.0

Paid 22/- 30 francs Bal 9/9.

Sunday1/7/17

Still cold & rain about. Rained hard yesterday & last night 

Boys off to Amiens on leave not taking any myself saving for Blighty. 

More Petty theifts last night. A Coy lost 70 francs. 

Pay. 10.9 £27.17.0.

letter from Maude & Percy Peacy.
Entry.99:
getting warm again, had to send 3 men back to Coys drunk. 

big Battle at Leus, Can hear guns here 25 miles away

expect my leave next week. 
Perhaps

Pay. 11/9 £27.18.0.
Entry.100:
Hot & sultry more rain about, Boys Broke pretty quiet at night now. 

C. Coy lost competition, D Coy’s stunt Tomorrow 

going into line on Saturday might have known it as its my leave next week. 

Pay. 12/9. £27.19.0

Wednesday 4/7/17/

Thunderstorm about 3 this morning Cool & like more rain. 

D. Coy 's stunt this Afternoon hope they win. 

Pay. 13/9. £28-0-0 

wrote to Viv, Maude, & Nell Monday. 

D.Coy. won competition great excitement C. Coy 2nd. 

rain to night
Entry.101:
Cool & fine & cloudy. 

Major Woods went to Blighty last night. 

Pay 14/9. £28.1.0
Entry.102:
lovely morning, nippy almost a frost last night.

off this morning 7 miles to Mailley Maillet. Hut camp good bye estaminets.

Pay 15/9 £28.2.0.

left Mellingcourt 10 to 11 stopped at Senlis 12 for cocoa & Biscuits hot marching but not too bad, Pack dam heavy. 

Through Hedoncourt then on to Mailly Millet got here Mailly 1.30 P.M. 

Beautiful camp among the Trees & shrubs 

went into the Town about 1 mile away, been a fine place but the huns as usual have knocked it about, but not as bad as some, 

The Town Hall is intact, also church.
Entry.103:
Beautiful morning but cold last night 

can hear the guns here, going night & day 20 miles from Arras. 

Pay. 16/9 £28.3.0 

Strong wind blowing & getting cloudy expect it means rain 

leave here in a few days & off to 10 Kilos from Amiens.

wish they would hurry that other stripe of mine along 

Amiens no good without money & mine all gone buying food, cigs, Battery etc 

Posted Post Cards to Nell, Tony, Jack & Carol.
Entry.104: Terrible storm last night thunder & lightening awful never saw anything worse in Ausy. started 2. a.m. & to day another came on been so bad that for the
Entry.105:
time since I joined the army no Parade was blown 

we are camped in a wood on a rise & the huts down the slope were swamped fortunately we are under a Tarpauline on the Hill & even so got wet through 

Pay. 17/9. £28.4.0. 

slept all the morning & nothing much else to do this Afternoon turned out fine about 4 PM. cool wind blowing 

D. Coy. going guard of Honour to the King.
Entry.106:
Cold, windy & cloudy, like rain 

having great spell here "Mailly Mailet" nothing to do all day. 

Wrote to Mrs Parsons, Loo, & Nell got letter from Viv. 

D. Coy. goes Tomorrow on Guard of Honour to the King. 

Pay 18/9 £28.5.0
Entry.107:
still cold & windy, scotch mist last night 

Big guns booming all along the line must be big battle going on.

Pay
Entry.108:
£28.6.0.

wrote to Percy Peacy. 

King going to interview us shortly. Hoorah do do ditto 

called to orderly room about my leave expect to go next week.
Entry.109:
D,Coy gone as Body guard to King Brigade Band with them. 

Lovely morning, fine & clear been very cold these last 3 days getting like winter again, 

Terrible air Raid on London on Saturday & Premier Holman nearly blown out the other day Major Gen Holmes who was with him killed
Entry.111:
£28.7.0.

Brigade out on stunt to day 

Got new shirt & chat shirt to day first for about 2 months. also Pr Braces first since leaving Ausy.
Entry.112:
12/7/17/

All the Boys gone to see the King the whole Division & others besides to be there I & Pat Shelly left behind on guard

Pay. 21/9. £28.8.0.

A Beautiful day Hot & sunny 

Expect to go to Blighty Tomorrow.
Entry.113:
Boys disgusted with long march to see the King so were not in too 
good
 a humour when he arrived & the cheers 
not
 what one would read in the Papers they were.

Another lovely day but it’s getting colder of a night & one Blanket is not enough.

Pay 22/9. £28.9.0

Brigade stunt tonight taking Beamont Hamel. 

all leave stopped till the 19th could have bet on it.

Saturday 14/7/17

Boys all home again at 9. a.m. BKs & hang-me if they are not out playing cricket now 10. a.m. been at it all night too, are there any other troops in the world like these lunatics. they live every minute of their time alright. All day yesterday it was cricket & cheeries, Rhaspberries, & Strawberries. 

Bit of a thunder storm this morning early & like rain now. 

According to the Papers things are very umpty-do in Germany.

Pay 23/9. £28.10.0.

Expect to get leave 
now
 on the 19th didn’t say a word yesterday when I heard leave was cut out, not /arf.

Viv has not turned up yet, a lot of fellows came back from Blighty yesterday. 

off on Monday for Le Bomphrey 10 miles away then North I think & into it again

RIP 3107 SGT J M Nelson 55th BT AIF died of wounds 20/5.17

Sunday 15/7/17

Rained nearly all night fine now hot cloudy, 

Played in Cricket Match yesterday finish it today made 2. hit G.W.

Pay. 24/7. £28.10. 

BCoy won Cricket Compt

off to morrow

Monday 16/7/17

Lovely morning up at 4.45 BKs. 5 moving off to Le Bompree at 7. 12 mile march have bound up my heels. 

going to be damned hot 

got there about 12. 

Pay 25/7 £28.11.0. 

Stopped for dinner 11.15. 6 Kilos from destination feet very tired, otherwisw fine, looks like rain. We will miss the cherries, Rhasberrys & Strawberries now

Tuesday 17/7/17

Rained last night, got Posy with Buglers noisy swines, feel nearly alright again feet got tired. 

Paid 20 francs 14/8 last night Pay to date 26/7. Bal. 11/11 £28.12.0.

much up with Anxac Police last night

Tuesday continued

got here yesterday Dubumpre at about 1.30 P.m. very tired & foot sore hard metal road all the way. 

We are about 12 Kilos from Amiens & 6 from Corbie about 5 from Rainneville. Be here for about 7 days then North I think. 

On duty all day till 11 P.M.
Entry.114:
Up at 1/4 to 5 BKs 5.30. Boys off to Corbie Pontoon Bridge Building raining hard thank heaven am left at home, they will be back Friday. 

Plenty of drunks last night 

Pay. 12/11 £28.13.0. 

Jack Thompson gone to Blighty I go next Batch. about Friday 

been raining & Scotch Mist all day very warm & muggy. 

Trying to clear up 9 P.M.
Entry.115:
Anniversary of Fromelles shall I ever forget it, I think not, & now we shall soon be off that way again 

The Boys come home again to day. 

Rained very heavy last night & men hanging around today. 

Pay. 13/11 £28.14.0. 

can hear the guns in the distance. 

Might go to Blighty tomorrow.
Entry.116:
Nothing much doing wrote to Viv & was sending Parcel but they wanted 1/6 so no good Broke. 

Had to arrest 7 men last night got them all quiet except one. 

Concert to night.
Entry.117:
Cool but fine, nights getting longer now & quite cool Blanket & Coat do not keep one warm dread this coming winter. Promises to be worse than last. 

Big Bombardment last night, Kit inspection yesterday. 

off soon now. 

Morgan struck an officer last of him for some time. Rip Rip 

Sunday 22/7/17

A most beautiful morning like our spring lovely & cool inside but the sun hot one of the best days I have seen in france. 

Spoke to Capt. Cotteril about my leave yesterday says I'll get it soon now. 

letter from Viv & Maude. Wrote Viv yesterday 

Pay 16/11 £28.17.0.

every thing quiet all the money gone. our crowd should be Paid 5 francs at a time.

Monday 23/7/17/

Another lovely morning like yesterday. 

The guns are booming away must be a big engagement going on near Bullicourt. 

Pay.
Entry.118:
£28.18.0.

Coy drill to day. 

General Birdwood gave out the Medals to our chaps yesterday. did not go to see it 

Had my paper fixed up for Blighty to day going on the 25th or 26th 

wrote to Viv & Maude. 

Big dinner on with Officers to night Brigadier & Staff Present. Unfurling the flag Fromelles & Doignes on it soon be another name to add to it. Thank heaven I am getting out of that 10 day’s march couldn’t have done it. 

We have Cinema shows & the Brigade Band also concerts but we see little of it all. always on duty.

Tuesday 24/7/17/

Another Officers dinner & Band tonight with Pictures after 

Got my Papers for Blighty today also new first since I left Ausy. 

Pay 15/1 £28-19-0.

going tomorrow afternoon 

wrote to Nell Jack Tony & Carol. 

Got to collect £3 for one of our Boys from the Comw Bank in London.
Entry.119:
off to day to Blighty going for Bath & clean clothes at 9. fall in at 3.30.full marching 

orders for a little walk of two or 3 miles to the Railway then only carry it from Train to Boat & Boat to Train. Warm & cloudy like rain am not excited about it. 

Pay 19/1. £29.0.0 

got to Puchevillers at 5.15 Train at off to Boulogne. Rosille, Doulens large Train going half round france to get to Boulogne . 

Flesdin H.Q, Gen.Haigh 

Etaples, Camiers, Boulogne. 

at 7 a.m. herded like Poultry in a big shed have to wait till Mid-day, Big fog. 

Thursday26/7/17 

Pay
Entry.120:
£29.1.0.

arrived London about 7. PM. after one of the worst of spells at Boulogne shut up a 1000 of us like criminals. 

England is not to be compared with France its France only cleaner & more beautiful & buildings not mud huts enjoyed the trip up splendid but very sleepy messed about at Horseferry Rd for hours then did not get my Pay get it tomorrow.
Entry.121: Up to my eyes in seeing London & carrying out requests of friends no more requests thank you
Entry.122:
not know whether to go to Scotland or not 

going to see Viv tomorrow at Perham Downs. Am staying at War Chest Buildings but shifting tonight to 91 Belgrave St "Tony eh!"
Entry.123:
per week Bed. 

Going Picture Show tonight & out Boating Tomorrow night.
Entry.124:
Up at 7. BK at ¼ to 8 off to Waterloo Station to catch 8.50 Train to Ludgershall Salisbury. 

Found Viv after a lot of trouble & had good old chin wag for 4 hours. had dinner with him 

Back to London 4.17 train then Theatre Lyceum "7 Days Leave" good Play cost me just 3/- not bad considering, in one Tube & out & into another revolving staircases talk about excitement this old London will do me 

They are all Girls here even the grey haired women wear short skirts & top Boots & the flapper, oh, well enough said. Wouldnt have missed this Place for anything
Entry.125:
Put in a quiet day did not get up till about 10. went to Hyde Park in the Afternoon but did not stay long, rained about 6 PM & continued all night so did not go anywhere went to Bed about 9.30 tired out. 

Wrote to Newton.
Entry.126:
nothing doing expect a reply from Newton making appointment 

Pubs open at 12 close at 2.30 open again at 6 & close at 9 PM Sundays 1. to 3. & 6 to 9. 

Am putting some guinesses stout under my waistcoat as everyone tells me I am Horrably thin. Am feeling well though. 

Sent post cards 

to Nell, Jack, Carol, Tony, Syd. Arthur, Jean. 

Raining again makes it miserable went this afternoon 3/- Trip on drag Westminister Abbey a Marvellous Place. Buckingham Palace mostly seeing Horses stables & the state coach weighs 4 ½ tons & a marvellous carriage, each horses harness costs anything between 100 & £200. No wonder there's taxes etc. 

The Kings state carriage is simply all gilt & is magnifiacent & his Horses are just 
it
. 

Going to Theatre tonight 

rang up Newton go to see him tomorrow at 11 am 60 Belsize Park. (Bus 24.)
Entry.127:
went out to see Newton at Belsize Park he was not there saw Mrs Moore had a chat & came into the strand & made appointment for 3 P.M. Am now here Just saw him & he recognised me straight away. 

Raining like hell Glorious country this Oh that I was back in Sydney 

went out by Taxi cost me 4/6 same back by bus 3d The curse of it all is you don’t know what bus to take & where it is going to when you do take it. 

Saw Newton he called for me for £10. ought to be here in a day or so wrote to Maude & Viv. 

Rumest thing I have struck is the women drinking in the Pubs there are more women than men at it & its quite the custom no one minds it. 

but to us its dam funny 

don’t know what to do tonight raining & miserable will go to bed I think.

7 P.M. Great battle going on glad I am out of it so far.
Entry.128:
Still raining curse it nice holiday got no coat so get wet every day. & have bonzer cold. 

Take good care of these Books for me & I hope they will give you some sort of entertainment. I generally put down in it what is happening & how it strikes me. Bert 

Love to all.
